greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n such that (number of distinct parts) < least part.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: b:= proc(n, i, d) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<=d+1, 0,
mathematica: z = 50; d[p_] := d[p] = Length[DeleteDuplicates[p]]; f[n_] := f[n] = IntegerPartitions[n];

b[n_, i_, d_] := b[n, i, d] = If[n==0, 1, If[i <= d+1, 0, Sum[b[n-i*j, i-1, d + If[j==0, 0, 1]], {j, 0, n/i}]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n, 0]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 80}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 12 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 30 2014
